column4: Hello, everyone. I have installed from 11.04 to 11.10 and it seems that even though I am connected to the internet, I cannot use the internet without painfully slow speeds. Anyone know a solution to this?
have you checked Additional Drivers?
It seems that when I tried to do that, it says there aren't any available.
Wifi or Wired?
Wifi.
do you have the hwinfo package installed?
Not sure, how would I obtain it if I didn't have it.
open a terminal and run "sudo aptitude install hwinfo"
It's telling me aptitude: command not found
try "sudo apt-get install hwinfo" (i'm an aptitude user, they work very similarly)
Already started install aptitude, but it's going at a painfully slow speed.
sorry about that, you can Ctrl-C it if you want
Alright, I'll do that and try the command above.
hwinfo will just give me details on the card itself
Oh, I see.
I'm not very good when it comes to stuff on the terminal...
I
i wasn't either, man. The more I used the WDM the more I realized that i could do things way faster with Terminal, but i enjoy working in a desktop envrionment...
is this an internal card that came with the computer, ie. a laptop wireless nic card
It's a laptop, so it basically just a wireless card that I'm just stuck with
not necessarily, but it should be fine
It's been working before 11.10, I'm not quite sure what made it break.
It's also been working on my 10.04 install.
